thing-type.label: FGMS001 Motion Sensor
thing-type.description: Motion Sensor<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtThe Fibaro Motion Sensor is a universal Z-Wave multi-sensor. Along with detecting motion the device measures the temperature and light<br /&gtintensity.</p&gt <p&gtThe sensor has a built-in accelerometer to detect any tampering of the device. The Fibaro Motion Sensor is battery powered device and designed to be installed quckly and easily on any surface.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<ol&gt<li&gtInsert the battery into the Fibaro Motion Sensor. Enclosure lock is marked with a dot. Make sure the device is located within the direct range of the main controller.</li&gt <li&gtSet the main controller into the learning mode (see main controller’s operating manual).</li&gt <li&gtQuickly, triple click the B-button - LED diode will glow blue.</li&gt <li&gtFibaro Motion Sensor will be detected and included in the Z-Wave network.</li&gt <li&gtWait for the main controller to configure the sensor.</li&gt <li&gtIf necessary, wake up the Motion Sensor by triple clicking the B-button.</li&gt <li&gtLED diode will glow blue to confirm the sensor woke up, and then wait for the main controller to configure the sensor</li&gt </ol&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<ol&gt<li&gtSet the main controller into the exclusion mode (see main controller’s operating manual).</li&gt <li&gtQuickly, triple click the B-button - LED diode will glow blue.</li&gt <li&gtFibaro Motion Sensor will be excluded from the Z-Wave network.</li&gt </ol&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtWakeup Information</h2&gt<p&gtQuickly, triple click the B-button - LED diode will glow blue.</p&gt

parameter.name: config_1_1
parameter.label: 1: Motion Sensor's Sensitivity
parameter.description: The lower the value, the more sensitive the PIR sensor.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe lower the value, the more sensitive the PIR sensor. Available settings: 8 - 255.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_2_1
parameter.label: 2: Motion Sensor's Blind Time (Insensitive)
parameter.description: Period of time through which the PIR sensor is “blind”.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtPeriod of time through which the PIR sensor is “blind” (insensitive) to motion. After this time period the PIR sensor will be again able to detect motion. The longer the insensitivity period, the longer the battery life. If the sensor is required to detect motion quickly, the time period may be shortened. The time of insensitivity should be shorter that the time period set in parameter 6.<br /&gtAvailable settings: 0 - 15<br /&gtFormula to calculate the time: time [s] = 0.5 x (value + 1)<br /&gtDefault setting: 15 (8 seconds)<br /&gtParameter size: 1 [byte]</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_3_1
parameter.label: 3: PIR Sensor’s “PULSE COUNTER”
parameter.description: Sets the number of moves required for the PIR sensor to report motion.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSets the number of moves required for the PIR sensor to report motion. The lower the value, the less sensitive the PIR sensor. It’s not recommended to modify this parameter settings.<br /&gtAvailable settings: 0 - 3<br /&gtFormula to calculate the number of pulses: pulses = (value + 1) Default setting: 1 (2 pulses)<br /&gtParameter size: 1 [byte]</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_4_1
parameter.label: 4: PIR Sensor’s “WINDOW TIME”
parameter.description: The higher the value, the more sensitive the PIR sensor.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtPeriod of time during which the number of moves set in parameter 3 must be detected in order for the PIR sensor to report motion. The higher the value, the more sensitive the PIR sensor. It’s not recommended to modify this parameter setting.<br /&gtAvailable settings: 0 - 3<br /&gtFormula to calculate the time: time [s] = 4 x (value + 1)<br /&gtDefault setting: 2 (12 seconds)<br /&gtParameter size: 1 [byte]</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_6_2
parameter.label: 6: Motion Alarm Cancellation Delay
parameter.description: Period of time after wich Motion alarm will be cancelled.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtMotion alarm will be cancelled in the main controller and the associated devices after the period of time set in this parameter. Any motion detected during the cancellation delay time countdown will result in the countdown being restarted. In case of small values, below 10 seconds, the value of parameter 2 must be modified (PIR sensor’s “Blind Time”).<br /&gtAvailable settings: 1 - 65535<br /&gtDefault setting: 30 (30 seconds)<br /&gtParameter size: 2 [bytes]</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_8_1
parameter.label: 8: PIR Sensor Operating Mode
parameter.description: The parameter determines the part of day in which the PIR sensor will be active.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe parameter determines the part of day in which the PIR sensor will be active. This parameter influences only the motion reports and associations. Tamper, light intensity and temperature measurements will be still active, regardless of this parameter settings. 0 - PIR sensor always active 1 - PIR sensor active during the day only 2 - PIR sensor active during the night only. Default setting: 0 Parameter size: 1 [byte] </p&gt</p&gt

options.option: PIR sensor active during the day only
PIR sensor active during the night only

parameter.name: config_9_2
parameter.label: 9: Night / Day
parameter.description: The parameter defines the difference between night and day.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe parameter defines the difference between night and day, in terms of light intensity, used in parameter 8. Available settings: 1 - 65535 Default setting: 200 (200 lux) Parameter size: 2 [bytes]</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_12_1
parameter.label: 12: BASIC command class configuration
parameter.description: Determines the command frames sent in 1-st association group.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe parameter determines the command frames sent in 1-st association group, assigned to PIR sensor.<br /&gt0 - BASIC ON and BASIC OFF command frames sent in Basic Command Class.<br /&gt1 - only the BASIC ON command frame sent in Basic Command Class.<br /&gt2 - only the BASIC OFF command frame sent in Basic CommandClass.<br /&gtValues of BASIC ON and BASIC OFF command frames may be modified by dedicated parameters.<br /&gtDefault setting: 0 Parameter size: 1 [byte] </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_14_1
parameter.label: 14: BASIC ON command frame value
parameter.description: The value of 255 allows to turn ON a device.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe value of 255 allows to turn ON a device. In case of the Dimmer, the value of 255 means turning ON at the last memorized state, e.g. the Dimmer turned ON at 30% and turned OFF using the value of 255, and then turned OFF, will be turned ON at 30%, i.e. the last memorized state.<br /&gtAvailable settings: 0 - 255<br /&gtDefault setting: 255<br /&gtParameter size: 1 [byte]</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_16_1
parameter.label: 16: BASIC OFF command frame value
parameter.description: The value of 0 allows to turn OFF a device.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe command frame sent at the moment of motion alarm cancellation, after the cancellation delay time, specified in parameter 6, has passed. The value of 0 allows to turn a device OFF while the value of 255 allows to turn ON a device. In case of the Dimmer, the value of 255 means turning ON at the last memorized state, e.g. the Dimmer turned ON at 30% and turned OFF using the value of 255, and then turned OFF, will be turned ON at 30%, i.e. the last memorized state.<br /&gtAvailable settings: 0 - 255<br /&gtDefault setting: 0<br /&gtParameter size: 1 [byte]</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_20_1
parameter.label: 20: Tamper Sensitivity
parameter.description: The parameter determines the changes in forces.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe parameter determines the chages in forces acting on the Fibaro Motion Sensor resulting in tamper alarm being reported - g-force acceleration.<br /&gtAvailable settigs: 0 - 122 (0.08 - 2g; multiply by 0.016g; 0 = tamper inactive)<br /&gtDefault setting: 15 (0.224g)<br /&gtParameter size: 1 [byte] </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_22_2
parameter.label: 22: Tamper - alarm cancellation delay
parameter.description: Time period after which a tamper alarm will be cancelled.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtTime period after which a tamper alarm will be cancelled. Another tampering detected durig the countdown to cancellation will not extend the delay.<br /&gtAvailable settings: 1 - 65535<br /&gtDefault setting: 30 (seconds)<br /&gtParameter size: 2 [bytes] </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_24_1
parameter.label: 24: Tamper Operating Modes
parameter.description: The parameter determines the behaviour of tamper and how it reports.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe parameter determines the behaviour of tamper and how it reports. </p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtTamper alarm is reported in Sensor Alarm command class / Cancellation is not reported.</li&gt <li&gtTamper alarm is reported in Sensor Alarm command class / Cancellation is reported in Sensor Alarm commad class after the time period set in parameter 22 (Tamper Alarm Cancellation Delay) 2 - Tamper alarm is reported in Sensor Alarm command class / Cancellation is not reported. Sensor’s orientation in space is reported in Fibar Commad Class after the time period set in paramer 22.</li&gt <li&gtTamper alarm is reported in Sensor Alarm command class / Cancellation is reported in Sensor Alarm commad class after the time period set in parameter 22. Sensor’s orientation in space is reported in Fibar Commad Class after the time period set in paramer 22. </li&gt <li&gtThe maximum level of vibrations recorded in the time period set in parameter 22 is reported. Reports stop being sent when the vibrations cease. The reports are sent in Sensor Alarm command class. Value displayed in the “value” field (0 - 100) depends on the vibrations force. Reports to the association groups are sent using Sensor Alarm command class. <br /&gtAvailable settings: 0 or 255 Default setting: 0 Parameter size: 1 [byte] </li&gt </ol&gt</p&gt

options.option: Tamper/No cancellation plus Orientation in space

parameter.name: config_26_1
parameter.label: 26: Tamper Alarm Broadcast Mode
parameter.description: Alarm frame will or will not be sent in broadcast mode.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe parameter determines whether the tamper alarm frame will or will not be sent in broadcast mode. Alarm frames sent in broadcast mode may be received by all of the devices within communication range (if they accept such frames).</p&gt <p&gt0 - Tamper alarm is not sent in broadcast mode.</p&gt <p&gt1 - Tamper alarm sent in broadcast mode.</p&gt <p&gtDefault setting: 0<br /&gt Parameter size: 1 [byte] </p&gt</p&gt

options.option: Tamper alarm is not sent in broadcast mode.
Tamper alarm sent in broadcast mode.

parameter.name: config_40_2
parameter.label: 40: Illumination Report Threshold
parameter.description: Change in level of light intensity resulting in illumination report.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe parameter determines the change in light intensity level resulting in illumination report being sent to the main controller.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable settings: 0 - 65535 (1 - 65535 lux; 0 = reports are not sent)</p&gt <p&gtDefault setting: 200 (200 lux) Parameter size: 2 [byte] </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_42_2
parameter.label: 42: Illumination Reports Interval
parameter.description: Time interval between consecutive illumination reports.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtTime interval between consecutive illumination reports. The reports are sent even if there are no changes in the light intensity.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable settings: 0 - 65535 (1 - 65535 seconds; 0 = reports are not sent)</p&gt <p&gtDefault setting: 0 (no reports) Parameter size: 2 [bytes] </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_60_1
parameter.label: 60: Temperature Report Threshold
parameter.description: Change in level of temperature resulting in temperature report.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe parameter determines the change in level of temperature resulting in temperature report being sent to the main controller.<br /&gtAvailable settings: 0 - 255 (0.1 - 25.5oC; 0 = reports are not sent)<br /&gtDefault setting: 10 (1oC) Parameter size: 1 [byte]</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_62_2
parameter.label: 62: Interval of Temperature Measuring
parameter.description: The parameter determines how often the temperature will be measured.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe parameter determines how often the temperature will be measured. The shorter the time, the more frequently the temperature will be measured, but the battery life will shorten.<br /&gtAvailable settings: 0 - 65535 (1 - 65535 seconds; 0 = temperature will not be measured)<br /&gtDefault setting: 900 (900 seconds)<br /&gtParameter size: 2 [bytes]</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_64_2
parameter.label: 64: Temperature Reports Interval
parameter.description: How often temperature reports will be sent to the main controller.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe parameter determines how often the temperature reports will be sent to the main controller.<br /&gtAvailable settings: 0 - 65535 (1 - 65535 seconds; 0 = reports are not sent)<br /&gtDefault setting: 0 Parameter size: 2 [byte] </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_66_2
parameter.label: 66: Temperature Offset
parameter.description: The value to be added to the actual measured temperature.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe value to be added to the actual temperature, measured by the sensor (temperature compensation).<br /&gt Available settings: 0 - 100 (0 to 100oC) or 64536 - 65535 (-100 to -0.10oC)<br /&gtDefault setting: 0 Parameter size: 2 [bytes]</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_80_1
parameter.label: 80: LED Signalling Mode
parameter.description: Way in which LED diode behaves after motion has been detected.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe parameter determines the way in which LED diode behaves after motion has been detected.<br /&gtValues from 1 to 9 = single long blink at the moment of reporting motion. No other motion will be indicated until alarm is cancelled.<br /&gtValues from 10 to 18 = single long blink at the moment of reporting motion and one short blink each time the motion is detected again.<br /&gtValues from 19 to 26 = single long blink at the moment of reporting motion and two short blinks each time the motion is detected again.</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: LED colour depends on the temperature.
Flashlight mode - LED glows white 10 seconds
LED colour depends on the temperature
LED colour depends on the temperature

parameter.name: config_81_1
parameter.label: 81: LED Brightness
parameter.description: The parameter determines the brightness of LED when indicating motion.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe parameter determines the brightness of LED when indicating motion.<br /&gtAvailable settings: 0 - 100 (1 - 100%; 0 = brightness determined by the ambient lighting - see parameters 82 and 83)<br /&gtDefault setting: 50 Parameter size: 1 [byte]</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_82_2
parameter.label: 82: Lower Ambient Illumination Level
parameter.description: Below which LED brightness is set to 1%<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe parameter is relevant only when the parameter 81 is set to 0.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable settings: 0 to parameter 83 value<br /&gtDefault setting: 100 (100 lux)<br /&gtParameter size: 2 [bytes]</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_83_2
parameter.label: 83: Upper Ambient Illumination Level
parameter.description: Above which LED brightness is set to 100%<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe parameter is relevant only when the parameter 81 is set to 0.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable settings: parameter 82 value to 65535<br /&gtDefault setting: 1 000 (1 000 lux)<br /&gtParameter size: 2 [bytes]</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_86_1
parameter.label: 86: Min Temperature Resulting in Blue LED Illumination
parameter.description: This parameter is relevant only when parameter 80 has been properly configured.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter is relevant only when parameter 80 has been properly configured.<br /&gtAvailable settings: 0 to parameter 87 value (degrees celsius)<br /&gtDefault setting: 18 (18oC)<br /&gtParameter size: 1 [byte]</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_87_1
parameter.label: 87: Max Temperature Resulting in Red LED Illumination
parameter.description: This parameter is relevant only when parameter 80 has been properly configured.<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter is relevant only when parameter 80 has been properly configured.<br /&gtAvailable settings: parameter 86 value to 255 (degrees celsius)<br /&gtDefault setting: 28 (28oC)<br /&gtParameter size: 1 [byte]</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_89_1
parameter.label: 89: LED indicating Tamper Alarm
parameter.description: Indicating mode resembles a police car (white, red and blue).<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtIndicating mode resembles a police car (white, red and blue).</p&gt <p&gt0 - LED does not indicate tamper alarm.</p&gt <p&gt1 - LED indicates tamper alarm.</p&gt <p&gtDefault setting: 1 Parameter size: 1 [byte]</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: LED does not indicate tamper alarm.
